page.title: 01THE BARFORD-BURCOMBE AREA
page.content: Barford and Burcombe villages are surrounded by open countryside which towards the river supports livestock, mainly sheep, as the ground will not support arable. Elsewhere arable farming, mainly cereals, is practised. The London-Exeter railway line runs mainly parallel with the main A30 road and the river Nadder. Main roads in the area are very busy with local and business, plus summer holiday traffic. Both villages are largely dormitory, the larger houses owned by business people who commute to Salisbury or elsewhere. There are small council estates which house mainly manual workers. The area is generally one of affluence and has been unaffected by the recent rcession.It is popular because it affords a country style of living but is close to places of work and entertainment in nearby towns.
